<body bgcolor="#CCCCCC" background="../../teach/classes/background.gif"
lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=WordSection1>

<h2><span class=SpellE><span style='font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>CompSci</span></span><span
style='font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'> (CS) 271 — Introduction to Artificial
Intelligence — Winter 2013</span><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'>Current Announcements: <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;background:red;mso-highlight:red'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";
background:red;mso-highlight:red'>The class website is under construction due
to a crash while editing it, and many of the links are broken.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This will be fixed soon.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Problem
#2 of Quiz #3 is now a pedagogical device (available <a
href="../cs271-old-tests/2013-wq-cs271-old-tests/2013-wq-cs-271-quiz-3-pedagogy.pdf">here</a>).
You may, if you wish, recover 50% of your missed points by showing that you
have debugged and repaired your knowledge base. For each item on which you lost
points:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>(a)
<span class=GramE>write</span> in the (incorrect) answer that you provided;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>(b)
<span class=GramE>provide</span> an equivalent English sentence, i.e., one that
is true in exactly the same possible worlds; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>(c)
<span class=GramE>explain</span> how your knowledge base been repaired so that
the error will not happen again?<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>To
recover 50% of your points, turn in your completed exercise WITH YOUR QUIZ <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>in class Thursday, 14 March</span>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Please
staple the pages to your quiz.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
Quiz #3 answer key is posted below and is also available <a
href="../cs271-old-tests/2013-wq-cs271-old-tests/2013-wq-cs-271-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>As
announced in lecture last week, the required reading for discussion this
Thursday, 28 Feb, is:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.0in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Searching
for Commonsense: Populating <span class=SpellE>Cyc</span> from the Web, <span
class=SpellE>Matuszek</span> et al, AAAI 2005<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>(URL
(background) https://www.aaai.org/Library/AAAI/2005/aaai05-227.php)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>(URL
(paper) https://www.aaai.org/Papers/AAAI/2005/AAAI05-227.pdf)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.0in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>It had
been displaced in the syllabus below, but now is returned to its correct place</span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
Mid-term Exam key has been posted below and is also available <a
href="../cs271-old-tests/2013-wq-cs271-old-tests/2013-wq-cs-271-midterm-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>A
new version of the C++ project shell is available. It now passes in the win
parameter K corresponding to the number of aligned squares needed to win the
game.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The new version is available <a
href="../projects/connect-k/NewTournament/CplusplusShell3.zip">here</a>, and
below in the <a href="#_Project:">Project section</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>In
order to reduce the amount of reading and focus on the most interesting
passages, the required reading of "Deep Blue" for Thursday, 31 Jan,
is hereby restricted to the following sections: 2, 3.2, 3.3, 7.1, 7.3, 8.1,
8.4, & 9.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Project
shells and a project specification have been released. See the <a
href="#_Project:">Project section</a> below.</span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>All
confirmations for the CS MS Exam that I am aware of have been sent.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you intend to have this class qualify
for the CS MS Exam, and you have not received a confirmation, please notify me
immediately.</span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>I
have created two CS-271 <span class=SpellE>MessageBoard</span> forums at EEE:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>(1)
Class Discussion; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>(2)
Seeking project programming team partner.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Lecture Place: DBH-1300 (DBH = Donald
Bren Hall, building 314 on the <a

mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The Discussion section is optional.<span

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>

</span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and
machine learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Please Note:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>This class is intended as a </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>broad introduction to AI</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>
for graduate students who have had </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>minimal or no exposure to
AI previously.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'> Students who have taken strong AI courses at
the undergraduate level may wish to skip or waive this course, and instead take
a more specialized course in AI or machine learning immediately.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>In particular, if you previously have had a
strong introductory course in AI from the <span class=SpellE>Russell&Norvig</span>
textbook, then most of the material covered here will seem familiar and
redundant to you.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You strongly
should consider proceeding directly to a more specialized course in AI or
machine learning.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span>There will be several
quizzes, a Mid-term Exam, a Final Exam, and an AI coding project.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>On
every second Tuesday as adjusted for the Mid-term Exam, the first 20 minutes
will be an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>On
every Thursday except before Exams, roughly the first hour will be lecture, and
the final 15-20 minutes will be open discussion of the weekly background
reading. Your active participation in the discussion is a required part of the
course, and you are not allowed to leave class when the reading discussion
begins. I believe it is important at the graduate level for students to grapple
with and engage in the intellectual content of the course material.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project, in which you will be provided with a
“dumb” GUI shell, for which you will be required to code the
“smarts.”<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are required
to form teams of two students, following the “<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming">Pair Programming</a>”
paradigm.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note that you are
encouraged to discuss concepts, methods, algorithms, etc.; but you are
forbidden to copy: (1) source code from any source, or (2) text from any source
unless properly cited and set off as a quote. Please see the section on “<a
href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic Honesty</a>” below.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers; it shocked me to encounter this level of personal
degradation at the graduate level, but I cannot control it and I remain
determined to create a fair and honest educational experience for all students
as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>Required:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Russell
& <span class=SpellE><span class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span
class=GramE> :</span> Artificial Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup>
edition.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You place yourself at a
distinct disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>R&N
estimates that about 20% of the material in the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition is new
from the 2<sup>nd</sup> edition.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Several of the chapters and exercises have been rearranged.</span><strong>
</strong><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(</b>A kind and helpful student
has elucidated some of the differences between the 2<sup>nd</sup> & 3<sup>rd</sup>
editions; <a href="../differencesEd3vsEd2.pdf">click here</a>.)<span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do
deplore the high cost of textbooks.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>You are likely to find the book cheaper if you search online at
EBay.com, Amazon.com, </span></strong><span style='color:black'>Chegg.com, </span><strong><span
style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>and related sites.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A student
kindly contributed the following suggestion, for which I cannot vouch, and
which I provide for your use if it is useful to you:<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Hello, <br>

I just wanted to point out that there does <span class=GramE>exist</span> an

Obviously, it is in paperback. <br>
<br>

<h2><a name="_Grading:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Grading:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
grade will be based on the bi-weekly </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>quizzes
(20%), an AI coding project (20%), a mid-term exam (25%), and a final exam
(35%).</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your participation in the open
discussion on Thursdays is required but ungraded, though you will be penalized
if you do not participate actively.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Quizzes will be given the first 20 minutes of class every
second Tuesday (starting the third Tuesday, and adjusted for the mid-term
exam).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your lowest quiz score will
be discarded in computing your grade.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>It is not possible to make-up missed quizzes, but one missed quiz may be
discarded as your lowest quiz score.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The mid-term exam will be given in class on Tue., 12 Feb.,
and is closed-book, closed-notes.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>It is not possible to make-up a missed mid-term exam.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The final exam will be given on Fri., 22 Mar., <span
style='background:red;mso-highlight:red'>10:30am-12:30pm (NOT the regular class
time)</span>, and is closed-book, closed-notes.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The final exam will cover all course
material from the entire quarter, but mostly the second half.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is not possible to make-up a missed
final exam.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Dates
and times for all final exams are set by the UCI Registrar (<a
href="http://www.reg.uci.edu/calendars/finals/schedule-201213.html">Final Exam
Schedule 2012-13</a>). <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>I make exceptions for genuine medical conditions (I require
a note from your doctor on official letterhead) or deaths in the family (I
require a copy of the death certificate).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Also, I honor all requests made by the UCI Disability Services Center.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Everyone is expected to read the background reading, and to
come to class prepared to engage in graduate-level intellectual discussion of
the subject matter. Arrive in class with: (1) a general understanding of the
reading; (2) one interesting point about the reading; and (3) one interesting
question about the reading.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>[Note:
Due to the large class size, not everyone may get to talk each session, but you
are required to participate actively at least once as the term goes along.] <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Every student who fills out a course evaluation
for CS-271 will receive a bonus of 1% added to their final grade, free and
clear, off the curve, simply a bonus.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>EEE will
return to me the names of students who fill out evaluations (but not the
content, which remains anonymous), provided that enough students fill out
evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will add 1% free bonus to the final

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_The_Computer_Science"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>The
Computer Science MS Comprehensive Exam:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>You must notify me if
you intend </b><b><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>to use this course to satisfy the CS M.S.
Comprehensive Exam requirement (info from the ICS SAO appears <a
href="../Student_MSCompExam2012.docx">here</a>)</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span class=GramE><span
style='color:red'>If you so intend, please email me IMMEDIATELY stating your
intention, and no later than one week before the Mid-term Exam.</span></span> <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p> </o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Please include your
full name and your UCI Student ID#.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Send the message from your UCI email account (to ensure integrity and
prevent identity theft).<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p> </o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><span style='mso-tab-count:
2'>                        </span>Eric
comments, “One thing to possibly discuss with the last slide is that the
itinerary it settles on does stay at a higher energy for a little bit until it
passes closest to Europa, maximizing the velocity before the insertion sequence
to the lower energy.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This is indeed
optimal behavior, as opposed to immediately reducing its energy as a Greedy
Best First algorithm using this heuristic would want to do.”<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:black'>Connect-K Game.</span></b></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This project corresponds to Game Search
(Chapter 5 in your book). Your job is to write an AI agent that can beat you at
Connect-K, i.e., to write the adversarial search (game search) controller for a
video game world. Shells will be available in C++ and Java.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I hope to be able to run a tournament
within which your AI controllers will compete against each other for Bonus
Points.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>A Java shell

example smart game is available; a Project Specification is available. <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
